Notes.Text:
This update for slurm_17_11 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-27745: Fixed potential buffer overflows from use of unpackmem() (bsc#1178890).
- CVE-2020-27746: Fixed a potential leak of the magic cookie when sent as an argument to the xauth command (bsc#1178891).
- Fixed %posttrans macro _res_update to cope with added newline (bsc#1153259).
- Fixed permissions of slurmdbd.conf (bsc#1155784).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: Slurm before 19.05.8 and 20.x before 20.02.6 exposes Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor because xauth for X11 magic cookies is affected by a race condition in a read operation on the /proc filesystem.
